member.name: T:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.RecognitionResult
member.summary: The recognition result from the engine. If the duplicated commands are recognized, the event(e.g. Result.Rejected) of a command may be rejected for selecting the command as a priority. If you set similar or same commands, or the recognized results are multi-results, the CommandList has multi commands.

member.summary: The recognition result from the engine.

member.name: T:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.VoiceControlClient
member.summary: A main function of the voice control API registers the command and gets a notification for the recognition result. Applications can add their own commands and provide results when their command is recognized by the user voice input.

member.name: P:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.VoiceControlClient.CurrentLanguage
member.summary: Gets the current language. A language is specified as an ISO 3166 alpha-2 two letter country-code followed by ISO 639-1 for the two-letter language code. For example, "ko_KR" for Korean, "en_US" for American English. An empty string is returned in case of some internal error.
member.value: The current language in voice control.
member.pre: The state must be initialized or ready.

member.name: P:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.VoiceControlClient.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the voice control client.
member.value: The current state of the voice control client.
member.pre: The state must be initialized or ready.

member.name: P:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.VoiceControlClient.ServiceState
member.summary: Gets the current state of the voice control service.
member.value: The current state of the voice control service.

member.name: M:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.VoiceControlClient.SetInvocationName(System.String)
member.remarks: The invocation name is used to activate background commands. The invocation name can be same as the application name or any other phrase. For example, an application "Tizen Sample" has a background command, "Play music", and the invocation name of the application is set to "Tizen Sample". In order to activate the background command, users can say "Tizen Sample, Play music". The invocation name is dependent on the current language. For example, if the current language is "en_US"(English), the invocation name is also "en_US". If the current language is "ja_JP"(Japanese) and the invocation name is "en_US", the invocation name will not be recognized. This function should be called before the SetCommandList().
member.param: Invocation name to be invoked by an application.
member.exception: This exception can be due to an invalid state.
This exception can be due to an invalid parameter.
This exception can be due to not supported.
This exception can be due to permission denied.

member.name: M:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.VoiceControlClient.GetSystemCommandList
member.returns: The command list, else null in case of no system commands.
member.remarks: In the system command list, there are system commands predefined by product manufacturers. Those commands have the highest priority. Therefore, the user cannot set any commands similar to system commands.
member.exception: This exception can be due to an invalid state.
This exception can be due to operation failed.
This exception can be due to not supported.
This exception can be due to permission denied.

member.name: M:Tizen.Uix.VoiceControl.VoiceControlClient.RequestDialog(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Requests to start the dialogue. By using this function, the developer can start requesting the dialogue to the framework. When the developer requests the dialogue, two types of texts, dispText and uttText can be sent by this function. dispText is a text for displaying and uttText is that for uttering. For example, if dispText is "October 10th" and uttText is "Today is October 10th.", "October 10th" will be displayed on the screen and "Today is October 10th." will be spoken. Also, the developer can set whether the dialogue starts automatically or not, using autoStart. If the developer sets autoStart as True, the framework will start to record the next speech and continue the dialogue.
member.remarks: If autoStart is True, the recognition will start again. In this case, it can be restarted up to 4 times.
member.param: Text to be displayed on the screen.
A variable for setting whether the dialog session will be restarted automatically or not.
member.exception: This exception can be due to an invalid state.
This exception can be due to an invalid parameter.
This exception can be due to not supported.
This exception can be due to permission denied.

member.remarks: The command type is valid for CommandType 'Foreground' or 'Background'. The matched commands of the command list should be set and they should include type and command text at least.
member.exception: This exception can be due to an invalid state.
This exception can be due to an invalid parameter.
